result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:15 PM Defendant Matthew John Piper in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie M. Rock in court for Matthew John Piper.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. State is in compliance w/victim's rights. Detective Nathan Hatch S&T D, X, RX.  Witness identifies defendant in court. Defense objects to bind over but waives argument. Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. State filed an information. Defense has received, waives reading and enters NG plea. Court does not have any formal PTC dates, atty's to pre-try on their own. Representative of the victim makes a statement as to future court dates.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Scheduling conference on October 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty. Stephanie Rock is appointed as counsel.
Reimbursement, if any, will be addressed at the conclusion of the case. 
The attorney shall be compensated at $100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court.
Copy provided to DE on 9/15
